data.text: In October our pilot Conny welcomes you from the flight deck as the Instagrammer of the month. Follow her on Instagram @flyswiss and check out how the mother of two lives her dream in the cockpit of a Boeing 777.

data.text:
As part of the 2030 Agenda, we are committed to seven Sustainable Development Goals ("SDGs"). Malte, SWISS Program Management, presents how important SDG 17 "Partnerships to achieve the goals" is for us: https://t.co/v1o8JyY17a🤝🌎🚋✈️
#Agenda2030 #sdg17 #sdgs2030 #ESDW https://t.co/waRKQ0rsNm

As part of the 2030 Agenda, we are committed to seven of the 17 Sustainable Development Goals ("SDGs"). Today, our polymechanic apprentice Jennifer tells how we are dedicated to SDG 4 "Quality Education". 🎓🔧📚✈
#Agenda2030 #sdg4 #sdgs2030 #ESDW https://t.co/lIE1zAS5Lc
We wish you a sweet weekend and send you off with an airy kiss into the free days ahead. 🛫☀️💋 https://t.co/h1BorKTWa6

As part of the 2030 Agenda, we are committed to seven Sustainable Development Goals ("SDGs"). Melanie, Corporate Responsibility delegate, tells us how we are working towards SDG 13 "Climate action". 🌱🌎🌤️✈️#Agenda2030 #sdg13 #sdgs2030 #ESDW https://t.co/vkZ94CzqN5

As part of the 2030 Agenda, we are committed to seven Sustainable Development Goals ("SDGs"). Today, René from Network Operations Control reveals how SDG 9 "Industry, Innovation & Infrastructure" is incorporated into his daily work.🛫🖥️📡🛬#Agenda2030 #sdg9 #sdgs2030 #ESDW https://t.co/xAvfLnoSV4

As part of the 2030 Agenda, we are committed to seven of the 17 Sustainable Development Goals ("SDGs"). Our Head of Swiss WorldCargo Lorenzo describes what SDG 8 "Decent Work & Economic Growth" means to us. 📈🤝✈ #Agenda2030 #sdg8 #sdgs2030 #ESDW https://t.co/MS6rHKb6ME

We are thrilled that the USA will open the borders to fully vaccinated travelers as of November. Now, finally: get ready for the big city life, your long-dreamed-of road trip or to hug your loved ones again. Where would you first fly to? https://t.co/w383Co9O8A✈️🇺🇸✈️ https://t.co/NiZPsjjkbI

data.text:
As part of the UN 2030 Agenda, we are committed to seven Sustainable Development Goals ("SDGs"). Today, our Maître de Cabine Benjamin presents how we work on the implementation of SDG 12 "Responsible Consumption and Production" within SWISS. 
#Agenda2030 #sdg12 #sdgs2030 #ESDW https://t.co/41TAP5w3ca

data.text: We welcome the easing of US entry provisions – one of our most important travel markets - and observe an increasing demand for leisure, visiting-friends-and-relatives and business air travel. For more information: https://t.co/gE5dzx4lXQ

#ESDW2021 #SDGs #Agenda2030 https://t.co/A4RrLAmqW1

data.text: We're proud to have won another award at the Onboard Hospitality Awards for our culinary concept SWISS Saveurs: Our Cold Cuts Platter with @spruengli_ Walnut Bread was voted Best Onboard Snack for Economy. If you haven't tried it yet, it's about time:https://t.co/2c6GJTA9PW🥪🥂✈️ https://t.co/2ZVlJvsa6A

We are trialling the possibility of offering our customers unsold food items at reduced prices on our services from Geneva, in collaboration with our partner “Too Good To Go”. More information: https://t.co/Eb6klwMdk3 https://t.co/P1uchHw2oI
We wish you a great start into the weekend. Thanks to our community for your beautiful pictures 👍🏼✈️ https://t.co/KUxk4iHkIT
Apologies for the delay in response Kiera. Just to reconfirm, so you would like to rebook your flights to the 26th September? Regards, Sione.
The sun is back ☀ Enjoy this late summer weekend, be it in the air or on the ground ✈ https://t.co/6GTayp3B3G
This month, Jan, our Instagramer of the Month in September, takes you on his journey above the clouds ☁️ ✈️. Follow him on Instagram @flyswiss and let his passion for flying take you away.
We conclude another week with amazing photos we received from our community 🤩✈️ Thank you, keep tagging us and have a great weekend. https://t.co/hRNNVNq2RP

We are making COVID-19 vaccination mandatory for our entire flying personnel from mid-November onwards, for operational reasons and under our duty of care towards our employees. For more information: https://t.co/snwaZKEr1z https://t.co/NrYa29jPcZ

We’re proud to present you our reposts of the week 😃Thank you to our great community 🥳👏   
You too can tag us with @flyswiss ✈️ https://t.co/SToHARcIrE

Due to the still-dynamic pandemic development, SWISS incurred an operating loss of CHF 398.2 million for the first six months of 2021. Strict cost and cash management combined with network and capacity control helped keep the loss within reasonable bounds https://t.co/ggQGzzgNLR https://t.co/x47WWOFk23
“As a cabin crew member the world has become my home” – Join Livia as our Instagramer of the Month in August on Instagram @flyswiss and learn more about her passion for flying. 🌎📸✈️
Today, on 1 August, we celebrate Switzerland’s national day: Happy Birthday, Switzerland 🇨🇭 🥳🇨🇭 https://t.co/NWWJJC1ILb

Early yesterday morning, our second humanitarian flight this week on behalf of @SwissDevCoop touched down in BKK with 26 tons of respirators & antigen tests on board. With @SwissWorldCargo we're proud to support Thailand in the fight against COVID19. Thanks to everyone involved. https://t.co/3g2oFijS8M

data.text: Bright cities, bustling markets and stunning vistas. Together we’ll bring the colour back to the world once more. data.text: Dear Till, thank you for showing interest and sorry for the late reply. There is not much more we can tell from our end, but maybe some of those topics can be part of SWISS future communication. Kind regards, Gwenn

Happy 5th Anniversary A220 ✈️🥳
Today five years ago, we operated the world's first commercial flight of an Airbus A220 from Zurich to Paris. Throwback to the arrival at Zurich airport. Here's to many more years A220✈️ @airbus @prattandwhitney https://t.co/pBD7fCDMmA

data.text: SWISS becomes the first commercial airline to fly from Switzerland with sustainable aviation fuel. SWISS CEO Dieter Vranckx: "This is a milestone for Swiss aviation on the sustainability front." More info: https://t.co/eW3jllji8z https://t.co/EFmPa5bbUP

As the peak summer season approaches, SWISS is offering its customers various ways and means to carefully prepare for their flights and make their air travel experience as smooth and enjoyable as possible. Find out more: https://t.co/xjDWILPlzj

data.text:
Hmmm… Happy World Chocolate Day 🍫
We love to sweeten your stay with us on board – not only today ☺️ 
Find out more about the story behind our chocolate: https://t.co/MjbAetSpCP https://t.co/l5zZ8PpX8p

Let's head north: Yesterday we could celebrate two first flights with water salutes: Twice a week you can now fly directly from Zurich to the capital of Estonia, Tallinn, and to the home of LEGO, Billund. Thank you for the warm welcome @TLLairport and @BillundAirport. https://t.co/eAK2nVQX1j

data.text: “Welcome on board, this is your pilot speaking…” as our Instagramer of the month in July, our First Officer Felix takes you across Europe on Instagram @flyswiss and will explain many interesting facts about his job in the flight deck. Stay tuned. 🤩 🛫

data.text: Our new Premium Economy seat comes with a significant advantage: the possibility of reclining further back without disturbing guests located directly behind. It is also equipped with a foldout leg rest for more comfort. Check out more features of the seat: https://t.co/C2mWy8ZL4X https://t.co/qjC4KCnc9w

Travel memories shape our personalities and stay with us forever. During the pandemic we were unable to collect moments of this kind. Find out how important travelling is for us and let's make new memories: https://t.co/1UtcCaAUF7

data.text: SWISS today unveiled its new Premium Economy Class. With this, SWISS is meeting its customers’ growing demand for more privacy, comfort and individuality and is also further strengthening its premium positioning in the growing leisure travel segment. https://t.co/gBR8G6V5GK https://t.co/Zh8vRRaal4

data.text: Our SWISSness comes in many different shapes and colours: Pride Month is coming to an end but we will further celebrate and promote more equality, tolerance and diversity. #LGBT #SWISSatheart. https://t.co/r1vBcvGsZU

Following a constructive consultation procedure, SWISS will downsize its aircraft fleet by 15 per cent and reduces unavoidable dismissals for operational reasons. For more information: https://t.co/gfA2e2c6lw
Equality, Tolerance and Diversity are pillars of our culture at SWISS, that’s why we celebrate pride month. https://t.co/3ZkH6I1rFR
As Instagramer of the month in June, Malory will awaken your wanderlust and takes you on board of SWISS. Follow her journey on Instagram @flyswiss and get an exciting glimpse behind the scenes. 🛫

data.text: Happy #InternationalFlightAttendantDay: Thank you to our cabin crew members for their dedication and endless hospitality, especially in times like these. For bringing people together, spreading smiles with their eyes and taking passionately great care of our guests.✨✈️ https://t.co/mG2ffmPv97

After its arrival, SWISS’s latest A220-300, HB-JCU, was formally named ‘Davos’ in a ceremony attended by  SWISS pilot and A220 Programme Leader Peter Koch, Destination Davos Klosters CEO Reto Branschi, Davos Mayor Philipp Wilhelm and SWISS CEO Dieter Vranckx. #davosklosters https://t.co/A0C79P2A0s

data.text: SWISS extends the option to change reservations without a rebooking fee once more. All airline fares can still be rebooked free of charge as often as desired until 31 July 2021, if the rebooking is also made before that date. For further information: https://t.co/D4JKuNvnwc https://t.co/udhRbevcNe

Yesterday, we shipped medical supplies to Delhi on behalf of @EDA_DFAE & @SwissDevCoop. Supported by our air cargo division @SwissWorldCargo we carried 600 oxygen concentrators & 50 respirators onboard our A330. We are proud to make a contribution and provide the much needed aid. https://t.co/K7dJkpQMOY

SWISS plans restructuring in response to structural market change but will continue to pursue its premium positioning and maintain its operations from both Zurich and Geneva to ensure that Switzerland remains connected with the world. For more information: https://t.co/W8HNoiOzGl https://t.co/FkKWd4EEFW

SWISS is further expanding its range of special assistance services for its customers. SWISS guests with special needs can now benefit from a personal companion and medical assistance service before, during or after their flight for a fee. More info: https://t.co/8g4Y66Jdx0 https://t.co/lNGN4F7820

In May, Olivia takes you above the clouds as our Instagramer of the month and gives you exciting insights into her job as a flight attendant at SWISS. Follow her journey on Instagram @flyswiss and learn more about her world.

data.text: With full power into the weekend🌸☀️ https://t.co/rdvDwniDIx

Despite comprehensive cost savings, SWISS sustained an operating loss of CHF -201 million for the first three months of 2021 as a result of the continuing extensive travel restrictions. The company’s liquidity, however, remains secured. https://t.co/ijyvVvQGA0 https://t.co/qzNxJYLWif
Happy World Pilots’ Day 👩🏼✈️👨✈️ Thumbs up to our SWISS pilots flying you safely through the sky, no matter how far👍 #WorldPilotsDay #flyswiss https://t.co/jjiOoYvwx3
And what breathtaking scenery does the weekend have in store for you?🌍✨ https://t.co/olhIJIAb1w
Spring is coming 🌻🌞 enjoy the weekend https://t.co/nzh2xnjaxV

Representatives from Switzerland’s air transport, tourism and other business sectors & organizations met for a virtual Back in the Air Summit. data.text: As of today SWISS extends its award-winning culinary concept SWISS Saveurs to a majority of European flights from/to Zurich in SWISS Economy. From a menu that focuses on local producers such as @spruengli, our guests can now order exactly what they desire. Find out more:
SWISS CEO Dieter Vranckx spoke on https://t.co/xSBjlaVHvO about who he is and how he is going to manage the coronavirus crisis: https://t.co/3zKcke04B1

data.text: Dieter Vranckx continued: “The goal must be to have the standard adopted by many, if not all EU countries. We count on Switzerland to adopt this EU initiative, and to initiate connectivity."

SWISS CEO Dieter Vranckx commented on the Digital Green Certificate announced on 17 March by the EU at yesterday’s LITRA event: “SWISS welcomes the EU Digital Green Certificate initiative. It will support free travel, and allow for travel planning stability." https://t.co/rwABSOT5La

data.text: 🛫 Ready for take-off into the weekend? 🛫 https://t.co/ud8RTe4r3o

“As well as managing the present crisis and ensuring our future viability, further developing our climate protection measures remains one of our top priorities,” SWISS CEO Dieter Vranckx confirms. https://t.co/w3YJoHTy9s

“If SWISS is to continue to offer Switzerland a wide range of direct passenger and cargo air connections all over the world, we need mobility-promoting parameters that are as standardized as possible,” says SWISS CEO Dieter Vranckx. https://t.co/83d4pxDPVh

“It is now abundantly clear that the entire airline industry will undergo tangible structural change,” says SWISS CEO Dieter Vranckx. “So we at SWISS will also have to consider a more radical resizing than we have envisaged to date.” https://t.co/tVxHQRcm0P

“We aren’t expecting any tangible recovery before mid-summer 2021,” says SWISS CCO Tamur Goudarzi Pour. “But as vaccinations increase and with demand only deferred, we expect to be back at about 65% of our 2019 capacity by the third-quarter period.” https://t.co/5dMNafFoTs

“We responded immediately with a comprehensive package of measures to the pandemic-related slump in demand,” says SWISS CFO Markus Binkert. “Thanks to this and a strong contribution from @SwissWorldCargo, we could keep the losses in reasonable bounds.” https://t.co/htsqVP5lAN
SWISS operated around 70% fewer flights last year than it had in 2019 and transported some 75% fewer passengers. https://t.co/ujSpAUWCi5

“The global air transport sector suffered a historic slump in the Corona Year of 2020,” says SWISS CEO Dieter Vranckx. “The COVID-19 pandemic has had a far greater impact on commercial aviation than did previous exogenous shocks.” https://t.co/8EW0QrBVec

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text: The coronavirus pandemic and the resulting travel restrictions have led to an unprecedented slump in demand for air travel and SWISS’s first negative annual earnings result in 15 years. SWISS incurred an operating loss for 2020 of CHF 654 million. https://t.co/kRTmFJKeKf

data.text: With the necessary wanderlust in his blood, Reda applied to become a flight attendant at SWISS. In March he accompanies you through the beginning of spring and shows you on Instagram @flyswiss what he has learned and experienced so far.

data.text: SWISS takes off with @spruengli_. We are extending our 'SWISS Saveurs' concept for Economy Class travellers to our short- and medium-haul services from/to Zurich from the end of March. For all fresh items on the SWISS Saveurs menu we will be working exclusively with @spruengli_.
✈️We are happy to announce our flight schedule as of April 2021. https://t.co/eHMQZ6OLp6
📷 Keep the camera ready. Switzerland is in for a spring-like weekend with spectacular sunrises. 🌄 https://t.co/bLdqctikiE
🎵All you need is love🎵Happy Valentine’s Day. https://t.co/kDjpB96hlv
In view of the upcoming Valentine's Day we start into a romantic weekend 🧡. https://t.co/jsbxi56xRV

Flexibility is needed now. For this reason, we are once again extending the free rebooking of all SWISS fares. Tickets issued up to May 31, 2021 can be rebooked free of charge as often as you like if the rebooking is also made by then. More info: https://t.co/cFjeRgSB0W https://t.co/en4il7ScIK
❄️⛷️ With this view we start the weekend #flyinginthoughts. https://t.co/7anek9gHUl

From 8 February 2021 onwards, all flight guests travelling to or transition in Switzerland must fill in the electronic passenger locator form (ePLF) and submit proof of a negative PCR test result when entering to Switzerland. More info: https://t.co/VVCvncbjg1 https://t.co/6NxjA8M7v0

data.text: SWISS temporarily reduces its Geneva flight operations to an absolute minimum until the end of February due to further-tightened travel restrictions. For more info: https://t.co/jQJxReuNA2 https://t.co/8RqHS0cjvm
Follow Femke and her freedom above the clouds in February on Instagram @flyswiss.

data.text: Wishing you blue skies and sunshine for the weekend. ☀️ https://t.co/bdYfwcuOmN

SWISS extends rebooking deadlines for selected tickets. Tickets that were purchased before August 31, 2020 can be rebooked until May 31, 2021. More infos: https://t.co/N97w02zwf6 https://t.co/JidYLqqSVY

As of February 1, a requirement to wear a medical protective mask on flights to/from Germany will be introduced. Passengers are required to wear either surgical masks or FFP2 masks during boarding, the flight and when leaving the aircraft. Everyday masks are no longer permitted. https://t.co/BuhY7fSpxs
Let it snow, let it snow, let it snow.❄️☃️ https://t.co/9lSWQqT5uo

This week, our Swiss WorldCargo achieved another milestone: For the first time, LX2700 touched down in Lima, Peru. A Boeing 777-300ER will now connect Zurich to one of South America’s largest economies, with several more flights planned for the coming weeks. https://t.co/aqAOrdlfW2

data.text: Last weekend, we operated our first cargo-only flight from Zürich to Seoul. LX2796 took off in snowy Zurich on Friday and landed safely early morning in Seoul on Saturday. We are looking forward to more flights to Seoul 📦📦. https://t.co/wJfVW5e4jV
